data.description: Location(s):United States of AmericaCity/Cities:AtlantaTravel Required:00% - 25%Relocation Provided:NoJob Posting End Date:January 23, 2026Shift:Job Description Summary: Candidates are encouraged to apply to 3 or fewer internship roles during a given internship recruiting cycleThe RGM Data Engineer Intern will join the Data Science & Engineering team within the RGM Capabilities & Insights group. This role will involve supporting business objectives of different teams, optimizing finance performance review, tracking routines, managing business performance, and planning key RGM processes. Projects assigned will include dimensional pricing analytics; developing automated submission/approval tools; data harmonization; and data visualization. This is an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the fast-paced consumer goods industry, working with a global leader in the beverage sector.Key ResponsibilitiesAssist in designing and implementing data pipelines using tools such as Databricks and Spark.Support ETL processes and integrate data from multiple sources into centralized repositories.Help maintain and optimize data warehouses and database performance.Collaborate with senior engineers and data scientists on data harmonization, feature engineering, and visualization for executive reporting.Participate in code reviews, documentation, and testing of data processes.Troubleshoot data quality issues and implement solutions.Contribute to data governance and compliance initiatives.Provide forward thinking insights from industry/economics analysis/trend identification.Educational RequirementsCurrently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Graduate degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Data Analytics, a Statistical area or have graduated from their degree program no earlier than December 2025.Related ExperienceBackground in Data Analytics, Mathematics, SystemsUnderstanding of the CPG industry preferred.Previous internship or project experience in data engineering, data analytics, business intelligence, or process improvement is preferred.Hands-on projects using Python and SQL to ingest, transform, and validate medium-to-large datasets.Participation in team-based development using Git/GitHub (branching, pull requests, code reviews).Functional SkillsStrong collaboration, technical, analytical, and data visualization skills with the ability to conduct deep-dive analysisStrong communication skillsProficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, PowerBI; python and statistical modelingExperience in process improvement and operational efficiencyProficient in SharePoint managementCreative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving abilitiesExcellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.Detail-oriented, self-motivated, and eager to learn in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.Collaborate with RGM teams to analyze market trends, sales performance, and pricing strategies.Assist in the development of forecasting models and reports that drive revenue growth strategies.Support the team in preparing presentations and data-driven insights for leadership.Strong collaboration, technical, analytical, and data visualization skills with the ability to conduct deep-dive analysis on large datasets.Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.Ability to manage and organize documentation using SharePoint and version control tools like GitHub.Support the team in preparing presentations and actionable insights for leadership.CompensationMonthly Salary (undergraduate): $4,506Monthly Salary (graduate): $6,066Location: Atlanta, GeorgiaDates of Internship: May 18 - July 31, 2026Skills:Our Purpose and Growth Culture:We are taking deliberate action to nurture an inclusive culture that is grounded in our company purpose, to refresh the world and make a difference. We act with a growth mindset, take an expansive approach to what’s possible and believe in continuous learning to improve our business and ourselves. We focus on four key behaviors – curious, empowered, inclusive and agile – and value how we work as much as what we achieve. We believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years. Visit Our Purpose and Vision to learn more about these behaviors and how you can bring them to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. When we collect your personal information as part of a job application or offer of employment, we do so in accordance with industry standards and best practices and in compliance with applicable privacy laws.
requirements: Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Graduate degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Data Analytics, a Statistical area or have graduated from their degree program no earlier than December 2025.
responsibilities: Collaborate with senior engineers and data scientists on data harmonization, feature engineering, and visualization for executive reporting.
Participation in team-based development using Git/GitHub (branching, pull requests, code reviews).
Collaborate with RGM teams to analyze market trends, sales performance, and pricing strategies.
Assist in the development of forecasting models and reports that drive revenue growth strategies.
